description: Update a safety rule (an assertion rule or gating rule). You can only update the name and the waiting period for a safety rule. To make other updates, delete the safety rule and create a new one.

parameters.name: AssertionRuleUpdate
parameters.description: The assertion rule to update. The name of the assertion rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the assertion rule. An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the assertion rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name.

nested_params.name: SafetyRuleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the assertion rule.

nested_params.name: WaitPeriodMs
nested_params.description: An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

parameters.name: GatingRuleUpdate
parameters.description: The gating rule to update. The name for the gating rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gating rule. An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name for the gating rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name.

nested_params.name: SafetyRuleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gating rule.

nested_params.name: WaitPeriodMs
nested_params.description: An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

nested_items.name: AssertionRule
nested_items.description: The assertion rule updated.

nested_items.name: AssertedControls
nested_items.description: The routing controls that are part of transactions that are evaluated to determine if a request to change a routing control state is allowed. For example, you might include three routing controls, one for each of three Amazon Web Services Regions.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ControlPanelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the control panel.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of the assertion rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name.

nested_items.name: RuleConfig
nested_items.description: The criteria that you set for specific assertion routing controls (AssertedControls) that designate how many routing control states must be ON as the result of a transaction. For example, if you have three assertion routing controls, you might specify ATLEAST 2 for your rule configuration. This means that at least two assertion routing control states must be ON, so that at least two Amazon Web Services Regions have traffic flowing to them.

nested_items.name: Inverted
nested_items.description: Logical negation of the rule. If the rule would usually evaluate true, it's evaluated as false, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: The value of N, when you specify an ATLEAST rule type. That is, Threshold is the number of controls that must be set when you specify an ATLEAST type.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: A rule can be one of the following: ATLEAST, AND, or OR.

nested_items.name: SafetyRuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the assertion rule.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The deployment status of an assertion rule. Status can be one of the following: PENDING, DEPLOYED, PENDING_DELETION.

nested_items.name: WaitPeriodMs
nested_items.description: An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the assertion rule owner.

nested_items.name: GatingRule
nested_items.description: The gating rule updated.

nested_items.name: ControlPanelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the control panel.

nested_items.name: GatingControls
nested_items.description: An array of gating routing control Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). For a simple 'on/off' switch, specify the ARN for one routing control. The gating routing controls are evaluated by the rule configuration that you specify to determine if the target routing control states can be changed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name for the gating rule. You can use any non-white space character in the name.

nested_items.name: RuleConfig
nested_items.description: The criteria that you set for gating routing controls that designate how many of the routing control states must be ON to allow you to update target routing control states.

nested_items.name: Inverted
nested_items.description: Logical negation of the rule. If the rule would usually evaluate true, it's evaluated as false, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: The value of N, when you specify an ATLEAST rule type. That is, Threshold is the number of controls that must be set when you specify an ATLEAST type.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: A rule can be one of the following: ATLEAST, AND, or OR.

nested_items.name: SafetyRuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gating rule.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The deployment status of a gating rule. Status can be one of the following: PENDING, DEPLOYED, PENDING_DELETION.

nested_items.name: TargetControls
nested_items.description: An array of target routing control Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for which the states can only be updated if the rule configuration that you specify evaluates to true for the gating routing control. As a simple example, if you have a single gating control, it acts as an overall 'on/off' switch for a set of target routing controls. You can use this to manually override automated failover, for example.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WaitPeriodMs
nested_items.description: An evaluation period, in milliseconds (ms), during which any request against the target routing controls will fail. This helps prevent 'flapping' of state. The wait period is 5000 ms by default, but you can choose a custom value.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the gating rule owner.
